1.Text: So...the meeting place is the capital's plaza.

...It's rare for Beta to ask for a meeting. What in
the world does she want? ...Well, guess I'll find
out once I get there.
(Yesterday, I found a letter in my dorm's mailbox.)

(The sender was Beta, and it was a brief note that
read, "I will be waiting for you tomorrow at the
capital's plaza at the following time—")

(I'm heading towards the designated location, excited
by the mysterious message that seems to hint at the
start of something interesting.)
Alright...should be around here.

Cid arrives precisely on time at the meeting point
and looks around.
Ah, there she is... Huh?
Beta stands there, dressed casually.

(You can totally tell she's Natsume Kafka. Won't
someone recognize her? If they do, it's all over...
Not that that's my concern...)

(...No, wait. There may be something to a celebrity
doing something so brazen that no one recognizes her.
That would explain why she's acting so laid back...)

(And judging by the contents of that letter...
She might be testing me.)

(In that case...fine. Let's go with something from a
spy film. This calls for the stereotypical spy move
of "standing next to an associate as if you were
strangers and talking without making eye contact.")
...Well, let's get started.
Cid nonchalantly walks up and stands next to Beta.
...*ahem*
Hmm?
...M-Master Sha—

Surprised, Beta nearly says "Master Shadow,"
but hastily interrupts herself.

...Ahem. Sorry for losing my cool... How long have
you been here?

Jeez... If you were here, you could have
just said something.

Heh. You've still got a ways to go if you didn't even
notice me...
My apologies...
...Pay attention to your surroundings.
My surroundings? Understood!

(Huh?! True, it's dangerous for me to make contact
with Master Shadow so recklessly... Who knows where
the Cult has eyes?!)

(I called Master Shadow here because I was so
embarrassed to visit his dorm and be alone with
him, and now I've made a complete mess of things!
Beta, you idiot! You darn idiot!)

Aahh... My apologies for choosing such a public
area...
Don't worry about it... So, what do you have for me?
...Oh, excuse me. ...Here, this is for you.
Beta hands him a single envelope and a package.
What's this?
An invitation from Mitsugoshi and a special outfit.
An invitation and special outfit...

(That's got a good ring to it... Is it an undercover
event where we infiltrate some aristocrat's party?
Maybe there's a fancy dress code or something
inside...)
We've prepared a special "event" for you.
...Can I get my hopes up for this event?

...O-Of course! It'll take place the day after
tomorrow at—
Hey, isn't that Natsume Kafka?
...Huh?

You're right! That adorably beautiful silver-haired
elf girl—that's totally her! Maybe there's some kind
of event?

With those words from the passerby, people nearby
begin to notice Beta's presence.
Whoops! Oh no! I'll be going then!

Please read the invitation for further instructions!
W-We look forward to seeing you!
With that, Beta scurries off.

(Wait, hold on, did Beta come here without any plan?
Seriously...)
(Let's get out of here before things get messy...)
Cid preemptively departs the scene.

Oh, Natsume Kafka went that way! Maybe there's some
event going on!
No time to waste! Let's chase after her!

Hey, come to think of it, wasn't someone next to
Natsume just now? It looked like they were having
a friendly conversation...

...There's no one there. Sure you didn't just imagine
it?

...Whew. I nearly got caught up in the whole "Who's
that next to that famous person?!" scenario...

Well, I came prepared with two encoded magical
scripts in case something like that happened.

Anyway, guess I'll check what's in the invitation and
package. Let's see...
Wh-What the...?
To be continued...

2.Text:
(I've come to the location designated in the
invitation.)
(And awaiting me here is...)

The blue sky and white clouds. The blue ocean and
white beaches...
...and an impressive resort hotel.

So, it's not some elaborate mission but a vacation...
Well, I guessed as much when I saw the package
contained a swimsuit for me.

But I never guessed they'd go so far as to build a
beach resort... Quite impressive, Gamma, Mitsugoshi.
Quite impressive...

Let's see. If I recall correctly, the letter said to
enter the resort hotel... Guess it's that over there?
Cid enters the hotel mentioned in the letter.
The interior is luxurious and quite spacious.
The designated room should be somewhere around here—
We have been waiting for you...
...my lord.
Those voices... Beta and Epsilon?

On Cid's way to the room, he encounters Beta and
Epsilon.
Wait, are you two my guides?
Indeed, my lord! I will be looking after you!

You mean "we," right? Seriously, quit trying to steal
the limelight.

The others were actually supposed to join us as well,
but they got called away on urgent missions...

I see. That's too bad. I wanted to thank the others
as well.

Oh no! Please don't worry yourself over something
so trivial!
I'll tell them next time I see them.

After you two show me around, will we split up and
enjoy the resort separately?

No, we've been entrusted with the task of being your
guides, my lord.

Our mission today is to support you, my lord. I'm at
your service...even if it's unrelated to our mission!

Wow, you don't slack off, do you? Even when it comes
to having fun. I'll be sure to ask you for anything.
Yes, you can count on me.

Well then, my lord... How about I give you a massage
in your room now? You must be tired from all the
walking. Allow me to take care of you...
Wait, Epsilon? That wasn't on the schedule.

Oh? Beta, you're still there? Why don't you just
leave this to me, and you go prepare dinner or
something?

N-No way are you pulling something like this!
I'm also more than capable!
(Yikes. The two combined might be a bit of a pain...)

The argument between Beta and Epsilon continues for
some time.

This is the special room Gamma prepared. It's a room
exclusively for you, my lord.
Wow. This is amazing.

(On closer inspection...it's not just luxurious.
This looks like a room tailored to my taste...!
Yeah...not bad...)
What's this?

You have a discerning eye, my Lord. That item there
cost 5 million Zeni at auction.
Five—?! ...I see.

Those items there were priced at 3 million,
4.5 million, and 8 million Zeni from right
to left.

The furniture, bed, and decorations are all
first-rate. Gamma went all out in preparing
them.
I-Is that so...

(In short, this is one heck of a room... My sense of
money is going haywire... I think I'd feel nervous
just sleeping on this bed...)

(That said, she's got great taste. I want this entire
room for my shadowbroker collection!)
Heh... Gamma knows her stuff.
I mean, look at this piece...
Cid says this as he reaches toward a nearby painting.
Huh? That painting... N-No way!
Hmm?

My apologies! That's a doodle Delta painted as
a prank!
Huh?

It seems it accidentally got mixed in... Delta was
saying, "I can paint something like this too!" but
I didn't think it would actually get mixed up with
the other pieces...

...That said, I'm impressed by how quickly you saw
through it, my lord. You have a deep understanding
of art which is truly remarkable.
Yeah...s-sure.
Epsilon promptly disposes of Delta's painting.

By the way, when did you manage to build a hotel?
It must've cost a fortune.

M-My apologies! It seems we haven't kept you properly
informed!

After all, despite it being intended to expand
Mitsugoshi's influence, we did spend an
exponential amount of money...
No, I'm not worried about the money, but...

(They're doing interesting things without me knowing
again... I've got mixed feelings about that!)

Oh, my lord! We've also prepared a welcome drink for
you! Please enjoy!
Wow, how thoughtful. Let's see—
Wh-What the...?!

It's a drink called "Ramune," developed based on your
Shadow Wisdom!
(It's a summer drink straight out of my home world!)

(They've even replicated the indentations and the
marble inside! The attention to detail is impressive!)

....Pwaaah! It tastes just like summer!
Gamma is incredible!
...It sounds like Gamma's receiving all the praise...

I don't know why...but I feel like we're losing to
someone who isn't even here...
(Ack... This makes us look bad!)
(Fine, time to do something about this!)

My lord!
My lord!

...Ahem! Y-You surprised me... Wh-What's the
matter?
...My lord. Why don't we head to the beach soon?

The hotel isn't the only selling point of this
resort. There are also beautiful beaches!

Please make yourself at home, and you can visit the
beach afterward...

Oh, you're right. Once I unpack, I'll change and
head there.
Thank you. Well then...see you again later.
Whew...

Nice follow-up, Beta. It's rare for us to be on the
same page.

The hotel's interior is Gamma's domain. We don't
stand a chance against her here...

(But when it comes to the beach, it's a different
story. I'll take advantage of the setting and
my figure...)
(...to impress!)

The two of them enthusiastically head off to get
ready for the beach.

3.Text: Heh...

The blue sea, the white sandy beach and the blazing
sun... Even the breeze feels great. This is amazing.

Most beaches are full of people this time of year,
so having such a vast area to myself is a real
treat. I'm lucky to have it so good.

(Come to think of it, I used to occasionally visit
the beach in my past life...mainly for training
purposes.)

(Running on the beach and wading through shallow
seawater are great ways to strengthen the legs and
lower body.)
Well then, let's enjoy today to the fullest!
Sorry to keep you waiting, my lord!
I apologize for taking a while to change—
Eep!
...What's with the weird sounds?
My lord...in a swimsuit!

*sigh* Your well-toned figure...and that visible
six-pack!

It... It's all too dazzling! I wanted to mesmerize
you, but I've ended up mesmerized instead...
I'm...so glad to be alive...

...Wait, is this why you prepared my swimsuit in
advance?
N-N-No, of course not! ...Right? Beta?

Exactly! It's not like we, Seven Shadows, secretly
did a little brainstorming to intentionally manifest
our desires! No way at all!
I doubt that'll convince anyone...
(Maybe I should change the subject...)

B-Beta and Epsilon, your swimsuits suit you well.
They give you a different vibe than usual and really
bring out your personalities. Besides, you both have
great figures.

Wow! Such high praise from you, my lord!
Thank you so much! Heheh!

What!? You really think I have an excellent figure,
and my swimsuit suits me better and is cuter than
Beta's?! All my hard work has finally paid off!

Hey, Epsilon! You're putting words in Master Shadow's
mouth!

Hmph. That's what I heard. My job is to discern the
true meaning of Master Shadow's words.
Oh yeah? In that case...

My lord, have you applied sunscreen yet? If not,
leave it to me!
Excuse me?! Quit cutting in line!
Huh? Um, I can probably do it myself...
Cid obediently lays down on the beach chair.

Listen up. Don't interfere until I finish applying
his sunscreen.

Should you really be handling such a mission on your
own?

Ack... I'll do his back, and you can handle his feet.
Happy?

Of course not! You're probably planning on subtly
leaning against his back, aren't you?!
My, of course...not... Heheh.

Allow me to assist you with your warm-up before we
exercise.
No fair! Me too!

Fine... As Master Shadow's right hand, I'll handle his
right side. You don't have a problem with that,
do you?
Ulp... She took first dibs! Unforgivable!
My lord! I've prepared you a special drink—

—I'm first!
—I was first!
...Th-Thanks...

(This won't end well if I let myself get carried away
by these two... I've got no choice but to take the
lead...)

A-Alright! In return for your thoughtfulness, let me
teach you a new game that requires wisdom.
R-Really?!
How wonderful! What kind of game?!

I've got to prepare something, so hold on a minute.
It should be at the hotel...I think.

With that, Cid heads for the hotel in search of
something.

4.Text: Sorry to keep you waiting.
My lord...is that...
...a...watermelon?
Cid brings a large watermelon.

Yeah, it's just a regular watermelon. It's pretty big
and impressive for a fruit, isn't it?

My lord, did you wish to eat watermelon? If you had
told me, I would have prepared one that was already
cut...

Ah, no, it's not like that. This one is meant for
play. It's supposed to be uncut.

It's a game called "Watermelon Smashing." Have either
of you played it before?

Watermelon Smashing... This is the first I've heard
about it.
It's a new game of wisdom?
That's right. I'll explain the rules.

Cid explains the rules of Watermelon Smashing to
Beta and Epsilon.

...That's pretty much it. So basically, you listen to
the onlookers' directions while blindfolded, and you
use the stick to try to smash the watermelon.
...Got it?
Yes, I understand!
I understand as well, but...
What is it?

I don't mean to be presumptuous, but with our
abilities, wouldn't it be easy to close our eyes,
sense the watermelon's presence, and smash it
with ease?
Hmm...

(...Wait? Seriously? Did my whole game just fall
apart?)

W-Well, you won't know until you try, right?
Let's give it a swing.
Can you close your eyes and count to around 20?
Understood. Here goes...

Epsilon begins counting to twenty. Meanwhile, Cid quickly
places the watermelon a short distance away and
returns to his original position.
Nineteen...twenty. Okay, I'm done counting.
Now then, time to sense the watermelon's presence...
Hmm?

Huh... Even with my heightened magic detection and
senses, I can't pick up on anything... Why?

...How about it? Were you able to sense the
watermelon's location?

N-No... Continuing on like this would be futile,
so I'll stop here.
Epsilon slowly opens her eyes.

Wow... It was so close to me, but I couldn't sense it
at all.

Well, it's supposed to be a game where you rely on
people's voices, so I'm glad you couldn't sense it.
I-I see. Watermelon Smashing, huh...
Have you picked up on something, Beta?

...It's just a guess, but our usual targets have some
trace of magic energy or presence we can pick up
on, such as their breathing or bloodlust.

But this is just a regular watermelon. Since our
target doesn't emit any presence, we don't have
any clues to grasp.

I-I see! So, this is wisdom born from combat training
with no vision! Watermelon Smashing...is profound!

There are no bounds to the depth of Master Shadow's
wisdom!
Um...sure.
(Let's just go with that...)
In that case, let's do this! I'll go first!
Alright, I'm gonna blindfold you.
Eek! Being blindfolded...is kind of exciting.
*gasp* No fair!
...Stay calm...Beta... Next is your turn.
Yup, yup. That's right.

Oh, I remember how to tie the blindfold, so I can do
it when it's Beta's turn, my lord!
Oh, really? I'll leave it to you then.
...Wha—? No way!
Epsilon...you'll pay for that!

Cid covers Epsilon's eyes with a cloth, sets down the
watermelon, and adjusts its position. Then, he steps
back and calls out.
Alright, let's get started!

Since you're here, Beta, why don't you guide her?
It's fun being the one giving instructions. Give it a
try.
Oh, okay. Understood... Heheh.
Epsilon plunges into the sea.
Epsilon returns to Cid and Beta.
...Hey! You totally did that on purpose, Beta!

Wh-What?! No, I didn't mean to... It's just pretty
hard giving directions...
...I'll remember what you did! Next is your turn!

With bad vibes lingering between the two, it is now
Beta's turn to try smashing the watermelon...

5.Text: I guess it's my turn next.

(This time I'll be the only one to impress Master
Shadow. Sorry, Epsilon.)

My lord, is it forbidden to give false instructions
during Watermelon Smashing?

Huh? Oh, yeah, I guess. It wouldn't make sense to
trick someone when they can only rely on your voice,
right?

I see... I'm sorry... It wasn't intentional, but I'll
be more careful about giving misleading
instructions in the future...

Did you hear what Master Shadow said, Epsilon?
I'm counting on you, okay?

(Damn it... This girl! She's treating what she did
as a beginner's mistake, so she can just let it
slide, huh?!)

(I want to retaliate, but she caught me off guard...
Beta is tougher than usual today!)
(In that case, it's now or never...)
...Very well. Now then, allow me to blindfold you.

Oh, while I'm at it, should I also set up the
watermelon, my lord?
Sure, go ahead.

(...Epsilon is up to something. Well, Beta got one up
on her, so I'll let Epsilon do her thing.)
Epsilon starts to blindfold Beta.
...Hey, aren't you tying it a little too tight?

Oh, I'm sorry. I wasn't sure how tight it should be,
this being my first time and all.
Okay, I'm stepping away to put down the watermelon.

Now then...I'll put down the watermelon...just like
this.

Epsilon takes a few steps away from Beta and places
the watermelon relatively close to her.
And another right next to it...

Epsilon sets up a fake watermelon made of slime next
to the real one.
...Perfect. Now all that's left is to trust Beta...

Is that...a fake watermelon made of slime? Is she
trying to lead Beta to the fake one?

...Wait, but she also placed the actual watermelon
nearby... What on earth is she doing?
I'm ready, my lord. Can we begin?
Sure, go ahead.

Beta! Let's get started! First, turn around and walk
straight ahead!

Turn around...and walk straight ahead... This way
feels like the beach, so there doesn't seem to be
any danger.
Forward...straight ahead...

Stop! Take about five steps forward from there,
turn left, and then take seven steps forward!
Then, swing down as hard as you can!

Wow, Epsilon, your instructions are surprisingly
concise. At this rate, Beta should be able to hit
the watermelon.
Heheh. I'm Epsilon the Faithful, after all.

Epsilon is actually giving precise instructions.
But...why isn't she trying to pull anything?
It makes all this even weirder.
What're you doing? You just need to swing down!
...Yes, yes. I know!

But can I really trust her? Guess it wouldn't hurt to
try sensing the watermelon's presence. After all, I
haven't actually tried it myself.

With that, Beta tries to sense a magic response from
her surroundings.

...Hm? Am I picking up on a faint magic response?
It's circular, so...could it be the watermelon? I'm
sensing it slightly to the left of my feet.

...Heheh. Could this be an opportunity? I'm probably
picking up on the traces of Epsilon's magic.

It's true Epsilon didn't lie to me. But it looks like
her directions are slightly off. She wants me to
take a big swing and miss. Too bad for her.
Victory...is mine! Take this—!
—Huh? Owww!

Beta swings the stick down vigorously but is repelled
by something bouncy, causing her to fall backward.

Beta removes her blindfold and checks the object she
hit.

Ouch... Hey, what is this? It's not...the watermelon.
...Slime?
...You fell for it, Beta.

I guided you to the right place. How on earth could
you have missed it?

Perhaps...you doubted me and relied on your magic
detection instead?
Urghhh...
(I see. So that was the plan...)

(Epsilon prepared a fake slime ball with magic and
placed it next to the real one. Epsilon didn't lie in
her instructions, but Beta couldn't fully trust her
and ended up self-destructing.)

(A brilliant strategy, thanks to Epsilon's grasp of
Beta...)

(Wait, but this game isn't supposed to be about
psychological warfare! More importantly, they
failed to smash the watermelon!)
W-Well, it looks like you both had a good time.
Oh... Y-Yes!

I-I didn't expect it to be such a complex game!
Ahaha...
(You're the ones who made it complex...)

We'll let the watermelon cool in the sea and eat it
later. Make sure to follow the rules next time, okay?
O-Okay...

(...But since they're willing to go all out like
this, I'm happy to suggest another game.)

(Maybe something involving a little more physical
activity would be good. Let's see...)
...I know! Let's play Beach Flags.
Beach Flags?
...What kind of wisdom is that?

It's a sport where you start from a lying down
position and then race to grab a flag planted
a short distance away.

Thing is, there are fewer flags than participants. If
it's just you two, only one of you can get the flag.

It's like a slightly complicated short-distance race.
Want to give it a try?
Yes! I would love to!

Of course I'd like to try! Will this be a competition
between me and Beta?

I'd like to join in as well, but maybe after you two
get the hang of it. Let's start with that.
Cid sets up a flag made of slime a short distance away.
I'll show you an example first. Watch closely.

With that, Cid lies facedown with his back to the
flag...
Let me show you an example run.
Ready...
Set...
Go!

The next moment, Cid sprints off at a blinding speed.
Dust flies, and before Beta or Epsilon realize it,
he already has the flag in his hand.

Whew... It's been a while since I've done one of
these, so I couldn't help going all out... I used to
do 100 reps back in the day...
Wh-What speed!
S-So...this is Beach Flags!

Sorry, I got a little carried away. You don't have to
run that fast, but it makes for good leg and core
training. Try giving it your all.
U-Understood!
Alright, we'll give it a go...
With that, the two stand at the starting point.

First, lie face down and place both hands under your
chin.
O-Okay...
Okay, got it.
Yay! I won!
*huff huff*
Oh? Beta, are you already out of breath?

I-I've got nothing to throw back at you... It was,
um...a little hard to breathe...

When I lie face down...my chest gets squashed...and
it's slightly uncomfortable...

(N-Natural breasts feel uncomfortable when they're
squashed!? Oh no, I've messed up...)

Epsilon, do you have any tips on how to position
myself?
Y-You've gotta get psyched up! Get psyched up!
...Huh? Psyched up?

Th-That's right! Instead of relaxing and lowering
your guard from the start, take a deep breath
before lying down, and hold it in!
...I-I see...

As a fellow sufferer, I'm going out of my way to
teach you this once, so you better be grateful!
Got it. Thanks, Epsilon.
Grr!

...Good job, both of you. You both managed pretty
decent times for your first attempt.

Beta, it seems you got off to a slightly late start.
From what I gathered, it was an oversight on
my part. Sorry.

No, Epsilon found a way around the problem, so I have
only my own inadequacy to blame...

...I hate to admit it, but you won fair and square,
Epsilon! I won't lose next time, though!
Um... I look forward to the challenge... Ahahahaha...

(Seems like Epsilon's inflated chest didn't press
against her lungs too much.)

(Maybe she naturally adjusted them to be more
comfortable, or the pressure from the ground
didn't reach her actual flesh. That must be it.)

(Just to ensure it's fair, let's switch to starting
from a crouching position...)

Because of Cid's concern, they decide to begin the
next match from a crouching position...

6.Text:
Heehee. Finally, two wins in a row! I think I'm
getting the hang of this!

Damn it, Beta... You've got quite a lot of stamina!
My lord! One more round, please!

I'm in great condition right now, so I won't lose the
next round, either!

(...Well, it looks like they're both enjoying
themselves.)

(Thanks to having a competitor, they have the
sportsmanship attitude of "Again! One more round!"
even when losing. It makes me want to match their
passion.)

(Right now, I'm the epitome of a devoted coach! It's
my mission to stoke these young athletes' passion
and keep it burning!)

Hmm... Beta. You may be in the lead, but your average
time is increasing.

...Epsilon, your form is getting sloppy. Keep it up,
and you'll develop bad habits.

What? You noticed I switched up my center of
gravity to cover my fatigue? There really is no
deceiving you, my lord...

(I just spouted off something that sounded plausible.
That said, I have a good grasp of sports clichés.)

It's not good to push yourself too hard. Let's take a
break and continue from there.

(During the break, I gave some serious thought to how
I could get the girls even more fired up...)

(...The conclusion I reached is the classic carrot
and stick. A good coach provides motivation to
overcome tough training.)

(You know, the typical BBQ at the end of training
camp or treating them to a fancy meal. Those sorts of
tropes.)
I'll give a reward to whichever of you wins.
...Wait, that's not quite what I said...
Beta. Sorry, but I'm winning this match for sure.

...Right back at you, Epsilon. You'd better start
thinking about your concession speech.

Oh? But you're so much better at writing than I am.
I'd love to hear a concession speech written by the
famous novelist Natsume.

Hmm? Then how about turning the anguish of your
defeat into a song? In fact, why not a lullaby?
Coming from a famous singer like yourself, Shiron...
it ought to put me right to sleep.

(Whoa... That was pretty effective in getting them
fired up. I should also start thinking about how to
cheer up the loser.)

(What?! Both of them are off to a perfect start that
would put professionals to shame! They've seriously
mastered it in just a few rounds!)

(...Sorry, but the match is already decided. Victory
comes with consistent practice!)

(And I am the one who has come out on top up to this
point! The goddess of victory, no, Master Shadow
himself smiles upon me!)

(...After hearing Master Shadow's advice, my victory
was all but guaranteed. His words always save me.)

(What matters isn't what you're born with, but
knowing what you're capable of! I will live up
to...my lord's expectations!)

They're evenly matched! At this point, it's anyone's
game!
...Hold on. Did I put the flag over there?

The moment the two grab the flag, a monster appears
before their eyes. What they thought was the flag was,
in fact, its fin.
But where's the flag?! Where is it?!

I couldn't check properly because of the distance,
but it looks like it wasn't the flag!
The crime of depriving me of my reward is severe!

The two turn toward the monster with deadly glares
beyond anything they have displayed during their
missions.

7.Text: Grrarrr...
Hey, you two! You're okay...right?
Yes...of course we're okay...but...
My lord...um...about the reward...

Well...since that wasn't the flag, let's call it a
draw...
We'll start over again...
I guess it is what it is...
*sob* After all my hard work!

(I-It's hit them harder than I anticipated. I doubt
they're in the mood for a rematch. Let's switch
up tactics here...)

The two of you have improved so much compared to
the start! It was incredibly satisfying to watch such an
intense match.

My actual goal was to motivate both of you and
elevate your personal and competitive skills.
What?!

I think you both deserve the reward, so how about I
give it to both of you... Is that okay?
O-Of course it is! ...Epsilon, we did it!

Y-Yes! Looking back, I was able to enjoy myself
because I was up against you, Beta.
Beta and Epsilon exchange a warm handshake.

(Yes, this is it! The classic resolution where the
rivals acknowledge each other! Everyone loves
clichés—that's why they're clichés! That's right.
This is how it should be.)

So, what would you two like for your reward? Is there
anything you want to eat or any object you'd like?

...Please give me some time to think. This is the
most important decision of my life.
Um, um...
Something yummy!

Something yummy, huh? Something yummy... Hm? Which of
you just said that?
Boss man! Sorry to keep you waiting!
Hey, Delta, stop bothering Shadow.
Hmm. Not a bad place.
Of course. I put a lot of effort into it.
G-Guys?! What're you all doing here?!

We finished our missions...so we came to join in the
fun...

Boss man! I wanna play before we eat! Splash, splash,
splash!
Hey, quit messing around! Dumb dog!

Ack! Now you've gone and done it! Take this! And
this! And this!

Aaagh! Boss man, you're too strong when you mean
business!

Isn't it nice...playing at the beach with everyone
like this. Heheh.
That's good and all, but...um...my reward...
...Hm? Did something happen with the two of you?
Um... It's kind of hard to explain...

...Oh well! We might as well have fun together since
we're all here at the beach!

...Yes, I agree! It was a tie anyway! Let's have a
blast together!
Hm? Well, okay, so long as that's the case...
So...this is watermelon...

Earlier, Master Shadow taught us the wisdom of
"Watermelon Smashing."
I'm interested... Let me try...

I'm good at it too! The winner is the one who smashes
the watermelon to pieces!

I don't know the details, but I'm sure it's nothing
like that...
...Nothing beats us all being together. Right, Beta?
...Agreed. Let's cherish this time, Epsilon.

The members of the Seven Shadows have the time of
their life at the beach.

Together with Shadow, they enjoy an unexpectedly long
vacation.
Then, a few days later...
